name: Spicy Bean Sprout Salad
description: Dressed in sesame oil and Japanese seven spice, this Spicy Bean Sprout Salad is delicious as an appetizer or topping for your ramen noodle soup. My recipe is so quick and easy—ready in less than 10 minutes!

video.name: How to Make Spicy Bean Sprout Salad (Recipe) ホットもやしの作り方（レシピ）
video.description:
Refreshing bean sprout salad dressed in spicy sesame oil based sauce.  Enjoy as an appetizer or as a ramen topping.

For the complete recipe:
http://www.justonecookbook.com/recipes/spicy-bean-sprout-salad/

Ingredients:

12 oz (340 g) mung bean sprouts
1 Tbsp. sesame seeds (I used both white and black)
Chopped scallion/green onion for garnish (optional)
Seasonings
2 Tbsp. sesame oil
1 ½ tsp. soy sauce
1 ½ tsp. Japanese Seven Spice Powder (Shichimi Togarashi)*
½ tsp salt or more to taste
Freshly ground black pepper **

NOTE:

*Ichimi Togarashi (Japanese chili pepper) if you like it extra spicy.

**White pepper for more intense pepper kick.

Music courtesy of Audio Network: "Tear Drops"
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Check out my blog: http://www.justonecookbook.com/

recipeIngredient: ½ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt ((or more to taste))
freshly ground black pepper ((or use white pepper powder for a more intense peppery kick))
1 Tbsp toasted white and black sesame seeds

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 12 oz bean sprouts and cook for 1–2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 12 oz bean sprouts and cook for 1–2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: After cooking, drain the water really well.
recipeInstructions.name: After cooking, drain the water really well.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine all the seasonings: 2 Tbsp toasted sesame oil, 1½ tsp soy sauce, 1½ tsp shichimi togarashi (Japanese seven spice), ½ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt, and freshly ground black pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine all the seasonings: 2 Tbsp toasted sesame oil, 1½ tsp soy sauce, 1½ tsp shichimi togarashi (Japanese seven spice), ½ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt, and freshly ground black pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked bean sprouts to the seasonings and mix well together. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp toasted white and black sesame seeds on top. Garnish with chopped green onion/scallion, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cooked bean sprouts to the seasonings and mix well together. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp toasted white and black sesame seeds on top. Garnish with chopped green onion/scallion, if desired.

itemListElement.text: You can store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
itemListElement.name: You can store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

review.reviewBody: Added a little bit less seven spice and used nanami togarashi instead of the one listed but this was great

Just made this easy recipe and I found it was a little heavy on the sesame oil. Next time I may cut back on it and add a bit more shoyu for more of a salty flavor but this will definitely be a quick "go to" side for me to make. Thank you!
My daughter had extra helping of this, when normally she doesnt even eat bean sprouts! Tks!

This is a marvelous recipe and one that I make whenever I can! 
Everyone in the household loves it, and it makes a welcome addition to any meal (from noodle cups to thanksgiving dinner) Thanks for sharing this!
Simply delicious and easy to make! :)

Love the video.
So easy to make and very tasty. 
Going to try all salads, 2 per week....let you know my favorite.
